H0.text: Solvent is the substance in a solution that a solute dissolves in.

H1.text: Particles are the substance a solute dissolves in within a solution.

H2.text: Gas is the substance in which a solute dissolves in a solution.

H3.text: Atoms are the substance in a solution that a solute dissolves into.

A4.text: One or more components present in the solution other than the solvent are called solutes. The solution has the same physical state as the solvent.

A5.text: If the solvent is a gas, only gases (non-condensable) or vapors (condensable) are dissolved under a given set of conditions.
